reviews: In this game you dont have to fear zombies you have to fear your fucking teammates :D. Every time you make your way to the chocolate helicopter and run into horde of zombies its not them you should be afraid of but your stupidass teammates who might mistake you for one of these brain-eaters and unload an entire SPAS magazine into you. Nothing compares to this not Keiths stories and not pills jokes.

I love everything about this game I just wish there was a third one. The game could use more weapons but there are mods for that. Everybody should be playing this game it changed how I look at zombie games.

Endless amount of fun, especially since you can spice up the game however you like thanks to the plethora of mods suited to each and every person's taste. Every mode has its own charm and depth, you can grind on whichever one fits you the most, or switch it up whenever you're bored. I met a lot of nice people who gave me tips on how to improve and make my time playing even more enjoyable. You'll no doubt meet some trolls, griefers, and/or toxic people along the way - the "Block All Communications" button will be your friend - just block them and move on.
the game is really fun if you play it with your friend but its ok in solo version is really fun to even if you add some mod or addon its will be cool

The gameplay loop is addicting, the maps feel different and fun, the characters have interesting personalitites, the graphics still hold up and it is incredibly fun with friends. The workshop gives this game replayability like crazy. Highly recommended.

its a great game, easily moddable, and has a gameplay loop that keeps me coming back to it. wish they would update this to 64 bit, though.

One of the most addicting First-Person Shooter Co-Operative experiences I ever played back during the XBOX 360 days. Left 4 Dead 2 is great to play with friends & the modding community is what gives this game even more life than ever before & still maintaining good player numbers on Steam to this day & deservingly so. I highly recommend it it's genuinely a good fun time & an all-time classic. Still hope one day Valve can greenlit a Left 4 Dead 3.

Also, it depends on your choice but there's really no point in buying the original Left 4 Dead 1 as Left 4 Dead 2 includes both Left 4 Dead 1 & 2 bundled together. Left 4 Dead 2 has more content compared to the original first game unless you want an original experience. 

Also, watch out for Toxic players, keep your friends close & aware when playing together online.

One of the best parts of this game is not only playing it as intended, but by adding mods to turn anything in it to something you like. What other game can you be in a group with Rick Grimes, John Marston, Walter White and invincible fighting hordes of Saul Goodmans? Very fun game

This was my first ever video game that I have been playing since I was 3 years old in 2009. Literally. Over the years it has never gotten old, though the nostalgia factor does tend to help a lot. The Left 4 Dead community as a whole has done a masterful job of keeping the game alive through countless mods, including custom campaigns, for whenever you need a fresh take on the classic. While the bots do tend to be a bit dumb and not very helpful, there are many awesome mods to modify their AI to make them less frustrating, and give you a human-like playing experience. Additionally, I feel L4D was very ahead of its time, because of its unique AI called the "Director". Instead of a copy-and-paste experience for every campaign playthrough, the Director makes it so that the game dynamics (infected, items, pacing, spawn points) all vary based on the player's skill and current status. So if you're iffy on the prospect of "just another zombie shooter" give it a try, as it truly is a timeless classic. This game will forever have a special place in my heart.

short_description: Set in the zombie apocalypse, Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2) is the highly anticipated sequel to the award-winning Left 4 Dead, the #1 co-op game of 2008. This co-operative action horror FPS takes you and your friends through the cities, swamps and cemeteries of the Deep South, from Savannah to New Orleans across five expansive campaigns.
